lines.content: * Constructs a new Deadline task with the specified description and due date.
* @param description The textual description of the task.
* @param date        The date or time by which the task must be completed.
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline task.
* Includes the task ID, the "[D]" type identifier, the status icon,
* the description, and the due date.
* @return A formatted string (e.g., "1.[D][ ] submit report (by: Sunday)").
* Constructs a new Event task with the specified description and duration.
* @param description The textual description of the event.
* @param start       The start time or date of the event.
* @param end         The end time or date of the event.
public Event(String description, String start, String end) {
* Returns a string representation of the Event task.
* Includes the task ID, the "[E]" type identifier, the status icon,
* the description, and the start and end times.
* @return A formatted string (e.g., "2.[E][ ] team meeting (from: 2pm to: 4pm)").
return this.getId() + ".[E]" + "[X] " + this.getDescription() + "(from: " + start + " to: " + end + ")";
return this.getId() + ".[E]" + "[ ] " + this.getDescription() + "(from: " + start + " to: " + end + ")";
public static ArrayList<Task> tasks = new ArrayList<>();
* The main entry point of the Pixel application.
* Initializes the scanner and runs the main command loop to process user input
* Handles various commands (todo, deadline, event, list, mark, unmark) and
* manages exception handling for invalid inputs.
* @param args Command line arguments passed to the application.
System.out.println("Valid Commands: todo, deadline, event, list, mark, unmark, bye");
* Prints the standard welcome message and the initial prompt
* to the console when the program runs.
System.out.println("What can I do for you?");
* Prints the standard farewell message to the console
System.out.println("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");

* Marks a specific task as done based on the task index provided in the command.

* Marks a specific task as not done based on the task index provided in the command.

* Constructs a new Task with the specified description.
* This constructor automatically increments the static task count,
* assigns a unique ID to the new instance, and initializes the
* @param description The textual description of the task.
* Returns a string representation of the task to be displayed in the list.
* The format includes the task ID, the type identifier "[T]", the status icon
* ("[X]" if done, "[ ]" if not done), and the task description.
* @return A formatted string representing the task details.
